steps.prompt_title: What moment are you stepping into?
steps.prompt_body: Describe the real high-stakes moment coming up. Who’s in the room and what outcome matters most?
examples: Presenting Q4 results to the exec staff and defending the forecast.
Resetting a tense project review with a key client stakeholder.

helper.title: Keep it specific
bullets: Name the audience or decision maker.
Call out the moment that makes your pulse jump.

steps.prompt_title: How intense does it feel right now?
steps.prompt_body: Choose the option that matches your gut feel when you picture this moment.

options.label: Steady — the stakes are real but I can stay regulated.
Elevated — I feel the pressure and need a plan.
Spiking — it’s hard to focus when I imagine it.

helper.title: Why we ask
bullets: The coach tailors the next steps to your pressure level.
Own the feeling before it owns you.

steps.prompt_body: Name the trigger or risk that raises the stakes for you. Keep it short and sharp.
examples: Board members question last quarter’s miss.
Client sponsor doubts we can hit the new timeline.

helper.title: Pressure framing
bullets: Pressure: what happens if this goes sideways?

steps.prompt_title: Pick the lever you’ll lean on
steps.prompt_body: Choose the 3P lever that will give you the most control right now.

options.label: Presence – ground your body, pace, and tone.
Perspective – tune into what your audience needs.

helper.title: Quick scan
bullets: Presence: your nervous system is the message.
Perspective: decode their agenda before the room opens.

steps.prompt_title: Spell out the move you’ll take
steps.prompt_body: Write the single action you’ll do in the next 24 hours that ladders to that lever.
examples: Preparation – rehearse the opening story with my mentor tonight.
Presence – block five minutes pre-meeting for a 2-4 breath cycle.
Perspective – call the sponsor to confirm the decision criteria.

helper.title: Make it concrete
bullets: Start with a verb: draft, rehearse, align, breathe.
Limit it to something you can actually complete.

steps.prompt_body: Pick the line you’ll replay right before you enter the room.

options.label: “I’ve prepared for this moment—trust the reps.”

helper.title: Why mantra?
bullets: Repeat it while you breathe to anchor presence.

steps.prompt_title: How ready do you feel now?
steps.prompt_body: Give yourself a quick 1–5 rating after setting the plan.

helper.title: No wrong number
bullets: This helps track progress over time.
Lower scores flag where the coach can lean in.

steps.prompt_body: We’ll save your snapshot, lever, action, mantra, and confidence rating. Ready to lock it in?

helper.title: What you’ll get
bullets: A recap inside the coach tab.
Context for future nudges before the moment.
